section.title: Remittance (Financial Institutions)
section.para: The Remittance (FI) function allows remittances to be created for the payment of invoices through the Portal, by financial institutions. This section is not intended for non-financial institutions.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Remittance (FI) function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Remittance. Then select Remittance (FI) from the left side navigation menu.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, the link to the Remittance (FI) function may already be available in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - Options
section.para: The Remittance (FI) function allows access to the Fund Transfer module provided by Cash Portal. In the left side navigation menu, a number of options are provided for Remittance (FI).
The following options are available for Remittance.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - MT103
section.para: To create a new MT103 (request for transfer) Remittance, select the MT103 option from the left side navigation menu of the Cash services > Remittance page.
A set of initial details must be supplied through the first screen displayed. Note that this section raises a remittance request that must be approved (and actioned) by the bank.
The details required are:

Field
Type
Description
Entity
Enter the Entity the payment is to come from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid Entities.
Transfer from
Enter the account number that payment is to be made from. Click the magnifying glass icon to display and select from a list of valid accounts.
Recurring Payment
Place a tick in this box if the payment is to be a regularly occurring transfer.
When all fields have been completed, click the Ok button to specify the other remittance details. The following sections describe the additional details required.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - From Template
section.para: When creating a new Remittance (FI), a previously saved template can be used to pre-populate common fields of the appropriate form. Templates need to have been created at an earlier stage for them to be used (see MT103 form - Action Buttons for more information on creating templates.)

When the "From Template" option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Remittance page, it allows a previously created template to be used as a basis for a Remittance (FI). To use the template, select this option and a list of existing templates will be displayed.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Reference, Entity or Description field. To display all templates, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of templates are described as follows:
Field
Description
Reference
Template name
Entity
Entity the template is associated with.
Description
A description of the template
Each record is shown with one or more of the following action icons to the right of the entry, depending on its status:

entry.para: Symbol
Description
Click to open the template in edit mode and change its details
Click to delete the template.

section.para: Select a template by clicking on the Reference field of the required entry.
Complete or change the required fields in the rest of the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - Copy From
section.para: Select this option from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Remittance page, to create a new Remittance (FI) request, using an existing one as a model.

When this option is selected, a list of existing remittance (FI) transactions will be displayed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are System ID, Entity or Ccy field. To display all orders and drafts, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.

The columns returned in the list of existing transactions are described as follows:
Field
Description
System ID
Unique reference number generated by for this file, when the Remittance (FI) was initiated.
Entity
Entity the Remittance is associated with.
Ccy
The currency of the Remittance request.
Amount
The amount of the Remittance request.

Select an entry to copy, by clicking on the System ID field of the required entry. The standard Remittance request form will be displayed, with most fields populated with values from the original request.
Complete or change the required fields in the form and click the Submit button at the top (or bottom) of the screen when ready.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - Edit Transactions
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menuof the Cash services > Remittance page, it allows a Remittance (FI) request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed.

When selected, this option will present a list of Remittance requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but not yet submitted to the clients because the input user either did not try to submit or had insufficient privileges. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

section.title: Remittance (FI) - Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: When this option is selected from the side navigation menuof the Cash services > Remittance page, it allows a Remittance (FI) requests that a user has already started but been unable to submit, to be submitted by an authorised user.

When selected, this option will present a list of Remittance requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Audit Trail icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.
